my:Details.my:Title: Carriage of Windmill Blades on Deck ( Blind Sector)

my:Hazard.my:Description: OOW & Helmsman/ Lookout not seeing an approaching vessel or object due to Vertical & Horizontal blind sector from deck cargo.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: OOW & Helmsman/ Lookout briefed to check frequently this sector by moving across the bridge to see past this blind sector. OOW signs that he confirms to 'navigate with caution due to blind sector from deck cargo' in the Master's Night Order Book. OOW informed to keep very sharp lookout using radar to check this blind sector.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Pilot & Bridge team ( OOWs/Helmsmen/ Lookouts) not knowing about the blind sector.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: Pilot & all Bridge Team Briefed by the Master. Pilot Master Exchange form signed by the Pilot acknowledging specifically the blind sector & location .

my:Hazard.my:Description: Not seeing buoys or other objects while approaching the fairway due to blind sector.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: In area with TSS, confined waters, restricted visibility, dense traffic During approach to the port, radars put on proper range scale & set up correctly to best detect objects that may be obstructed by the blind sector. Frequent movement across the bridge to check behind this blind sector by the OOW & lookouts. One more look out added on watch.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Inability to judge distance forward correctly from the bridge during mooring/unmooring operations.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: Constant communication by VHF radio to the Chief Officer at mooring station forward to give correct information to Bridge about distance to any hazard.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Manoeuvring the ship while mooring/unmooring during strong winds.
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: Wind pushing against large deck surfaces must be taken in account. Thrusters and/or/if available tug/s should be properly use and Speed to be properly adjusted in this respect.

my:Review.my:ReviewMembers: ALL BRIDGE TEAM ( ALL OOWs + J/O+ LOOKOUTS + DECK CADETS
